title: The Letter V
content:
Hello all,

I really really like this 'V', and I am trying to identify the font.

Thank you in advance, always a helpful community.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141121192530im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-13%20at%206_5069.39.00%20PM.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-11-13 at 6.39.00 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20141121192530/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-13%20at%206.39.00%20PM.png) | 74.81 KB |
author: Anthony Prestanizzi

comments.content:
Dala Floda is great for this stencil look, but the angle of the |V| and its proportions seem closer to Lust Display (albeit blown out/edited so the thin right hand stroke drops away):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141121192530/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/")

Another ready-to-go option with [Regal Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20141121192530/http:/www.parachute.gr/typefaces/allfonts/regal-stencil-pro). You could also try to play around with [Caslon Fina Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20141121192530/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/caslon+fina+stencil).
